intro: Synzyganthera, commonly known as the false arum, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Araceae. It is characterized by its striking, often colorful inflorescences composed of a spadix surrounded by a modified leaf called a spathe. The plants typically have alternate, simple, and usually palmate leaves. They are native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. Synzyganthera species are often cultivated for their ornamental value due to their unique floral structures.
